items.title: Will Keir Starmer become the latest UK prime minister to be ousted?

items.title: Is my sunscreen safe or should I start shopping for an alternative?

items.title: Roadworks completed as construction of new Paradise Dam wall sparks environmental concerns
items.summary: More than 53 hectares of bushland and riverine habitat will be cleared for a major upgrade to a regional Queensland dam, prompting environmentalists to raise concerns about protected lungfish and turtles.

items.title: ACMA threatens ARN radio network with action over The Kyle and Jackie O Show decency breaches
items.summary: A months-long investigation by the Australian Communications and Media Authority finds seven breaches of decency rules between August and December last year.

items.title: Search for missing man Mark Sear scaled back in WA's far north

items.title: Alice Springs women's prison delay creating fears for inmates' safety
items.summary: The prison guards' union and a criminal lawyer say a government "delay" in building a separate women's prison in Alice Springs is increasing overcrowding and leaving female inmates too close to male prisoners.

items.title: States shoot down hospital funding offer, claiming it amounts to a shortfall of 'billions'
items.summary: State and territory leaders say the Commonwealth's offer for the next five years of hospital funding would leave them billions out of pocket, claiming the federal government is walking back a promise to pay 42.5 per cent of the share of expenses.

items.title: Australian homes could soon be built by spider-like robot called Charlotte
items.summary: Developers of a speedy, "spider-like" robot named Charlotte believe it could be building homes on Earth within years, and eventually further lunar exploration.

items.title: Hawthorn Hawks AFLW lose Emily Bates to injury

items.title: Tom Ballard's new show searches for the line between funny and offensive while pushing the comedy envelope
items.summary: Comedian Tom Ballard is swapping a stand-up stage for a dramatic one as his new stage show asks, how do you remember a divisive figure?

items.title: Calvary St Luke's Hospital surgeries transferred after micro tears found in the floor
items.summary: The shutdown of Calvary St Luke's Hospital will affect 40 planned surgeries this week, with 22 of those reallocated to nearby St Vincent's Hospital.

items.title: Pro-EU party wins majority in Moldova election in setback for Russia
items.summary: Moscow is accused of attempting to sway the election in favour of a pro-Russian party, but a majority of voters backed the pro-EU Party of Action and Solidarity.

items.title: Benjamin Netanyahu agrees to Donald Trump's 20-point Gaza peace plan

items.title: What could Thriving Kids, the NDIS alternative for some children, look like?
items.summary: Despite the government wanting its Thriving Kids program for children with "mild to moderate" developmental delay and autism to start next year, the system is yet to be designed.

items.title: Will the Reserve Bank cut interest rates today? Only if hell freezes over

items.title: Inside Iran, a paranoid regime hunts for traitors and spies after its war with Israel
items.summary: For 12 days in June, the world watched as Iran and Israel traded blows. What came next was a brutal purge of spies and traitors.

items.title: US to impose 100pc tariff on movies made outside the country, Trump says
items.summary: US President Donald Trump initially threatened to impose such levies earlier in May but offered few details, leading to confusion among entertainment industry executives.

items.title: Rick Morton's book about Robodebt, Mean Streak, among Prime Minister's Literary Award winners

items.summary: Brisbane Lions midfield star Will Ashcroft has added the AFL coaches' award for player of the finals to his growing list of accolades in the wake of his team's 47-point victory over the Geelong Cats on Saturday.

items.title: If China beats the US on fusion energy, its supremacy will be assured
items.summary: China is driving hard to supplant the US in this new military industrial complex, and has already achieved leadership in electric vehicles, batteries, drones and renewable energy.

items.title: Donald Trump's 'climate hoax' comments belong to a well-resourced playbook landing on Australia's shores
